text: Heat the pan till it gets hot. Add the butter or margarine, whichever you're using. Stir the butter to help it to melt. Add the cocoa powder. Cook gently for 3 minutes. Stir the mixture after the 3 minutes have passed. Stir constantly for another 3 minutes, or until the mixture turns a brown-black colour. Remove from the heat the moment it changes colour.  Sprinkle the Milo powder over the cocoa and butter mixture. Be generous with the Milo. Pour milk into the Milo mixture. Stir to melt the Milo mixture into the cocoa mixture. Return to the heat. Heat again and stir constantly, for 1 1/2 minutes. Add the condensed milk. Stir well to combine. Taste a little of the mixture. If it needs more Milo or cocoa, add as required. Stir through thoroughly. Heat until the toffee mixture turns sticky. Once stick, pour into a serving bowl or over dessert foods. Serve immediately. It's best eaten hot; the heat really brings out the Milo flavour.
